dt: {bc}the drupaceous fruit of a small tree ({it}Prunus dulcis{/it} synonym {it}P. amygdalus{/it}) of the rose family with flowers and young fruit resembling those of the peach
{bc}its ellipsoidal edible kernel used as a nut

et: Middle English {it}almande{/it}, from Anglo-French {it}alemande{/it} from Late Latin {it}amandula{/it}, alteration of Latin {it}amygdala{/it}, from Greek {it}amygdalē{/it}
shortdef: the drupaceous fruit of a small tree (Prunus dulcis synonym P. amygdalus) of the rose family with flowers and young fruit resembling those of the peach; especially : its ellipsoidal edible kernel used as a nut

dt: {bc}an almond with a bitter taste that contains amygdalin
{bc}a tree ({it}Prunus dulcis amara{/it}) producing bitter almonds

shortdef: an almond with a bitter taste that contains amygdalin; also : a tree (Prunus dulcis amara) producing bitter almonds

dt: {bc}a large Spanish almond especially when salted or coated with sugar of various colors

et: Middle English {it}jardin almande{/it}, from Anglo-French {it}jardin, gardin{/it} garden + Middle English {it}almande{/it} almond
shortdef: a large Spanish almond especially when salted or coated with sugar of various colors
